It is great and no complaints on it.My only complaint is I am out the $22 return ( I bought insurance - didn't want to be out the camera price) cost, which was no fault of mine.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera.
Reviews.Author: debbee
Reviews.Content: I saw pictures this camera took online so I wanted one. I got it.. used it .. took excellent pictures through the window of a blue heron that lives by us ! Never was able to do that before.Now the battery died , so I need to replace it... what do you think with a used product..?

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT!
Reviews.Author: CJ
Reviews.Content: I love this camera! It has survived a lot! Easy to use and upload pictures from. A great buy! Awesome!

Reviews.Title: Excellent Photo camera, horrible for videos.
Reviews.Author: Emmanuel
Reviews.Content: Very good camera for taking photos, but the audio quality in the videos is pure garbage. It is extremely distorted.

Reviews.Title: But you can't take pictures if the batteries run out
Reviews.Author: Renee D
Reviews.Content: This camera came with a battery that was not rechargeable. These disposal batteries did not even last through one event. I tried rechargeable AA LiIon batteries, but they did not last long enough to get me through 1 day of a trip. I purchased the Kodak battery designed for the camera and it lasted a long time. However, I cannot get a reliable charger for it. It will not charge with it plugged into the computer at all. I bought a plug in adaptor for the USB thinking the electrical outlet would be more efficient. It does not work either. After trying several different brands of rechargeable LiIons, I purchased the Kodak LIIon universal battery kit. The battery lasted a long time. I can get through several days of an event or trip. But...the charger prongs broke off the charger, so I have to invest some more money to get another. I have spent more money on batteries and chargers for this camera than the camera itself. In addition, my aunt had been complaining about her camera eating up battery life. When we got together at a family reunion, we saw that we both had the same cameras! She had been through the battery fiasco just as I had.

Reviews.Title: z812
Reviews.Author: meme
Reviews.Content: i love this camera, it is easy to use and i like the quality of pics Kodak Easyshare Z812IS 8.2MP Digital Camera with 12x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom :)

Reviews.Title: Kodak Z 812
Reviews.Author: Bill C. Youngquist
Reviews.Content: I paid 244.00 3 years ago from amazon. When you push the shutter button it takes a picture very fast,85% of the pictures are in focus. The flash recharges recovers quick It takes good videos its and lightweight The zoom works on videos, I think Ill try the Z1012 next. I tried the Z1015 and it was very slow taking pictures.  I would recomend the Z812 camera to a friend. Ive captured many pictures in split seconds of my twin boys that other cameras would have missed. I did start having problems with it jumping out of the review picture mode and others around 10-15-10. (note) This camera was dropped a few times along with being splashed so I can't really blame it.  lol

Reviews.Title: Macro photography
Reviews.Author: Evangelio Gonzalez "papa"
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera for several years, I too have Nikon D70 and a Canon EOS KISS X2. I use this camera for Macro photography with a $30 OPTEKA 10X Macro lens,a steady tripod and a $90 flash light with a diffuser.You can see some of my pictures in the customers pictures. I have save several hundreds or thousands of dollars buying macro lens for my cameras. I can take this camera anywhere I go, the pictures quality is very good if you use only the optical zoom and get pass the tunnel vision of the OPTEKA lens adaptor.

Reviews.Title: Still working great after two years
Reviews.Author: JW
Reviews.Content: This camera is my third digital camera and now is a little outdated because of the 12 megapixel and beyond cameras but it works great and always has.  This camera goes EVERYWHERE with us and takes TONS of pictures.  Get some extra batteries because this thing is a battery HOG and an SD card.  Also, if I leave batteries in the camera when not in use, it drains them very quickly.  Not sure why.

Reviews.Title: flash broke, camera no good- less than 2 yrs old
Reviews.Author: Kathy "nckitkat"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera after Christmas nearly 2 years ago. The colors are pretty good, and the only problem I have had until recently is low-lighting- pictures are not so good with low light, too much noise for me. Recently I have not been able to get the flash to work. I emailed Kodak, and they gave me a number to call. When I called and explained the problem, it was going to cost $!00 to fix it. I only paid a little over $200 for the camera. It is now on Craig's list and I am looking for a replacement...

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Ali Buttar "the guru"
Reviews.Content: Great camera with excellent results. Takes great panoramas and close-ups. In all a very happy customer.The only downside is, you cant use it with a normal batteries, eats them away very quickly. But rechargeable KLIC 8000 batteries work for a long time.

Reviews.Title: Refurbished Kodak is just as good as new
Reviews.Author: Kevin J. Mcauliffe
Reviews.Content: I initially had a previous version of a Kodak easyshare (I believe it was a 650, but at this time I can't remember) and while I was deployed my wife happen to drop it and it quit working.  So enter Amazon and the search for a new camera.  My wife is a technophobe (afraid of technology), so when considering another camera I had to make sure it was close to the old one because she knew how that worked, and since I am deployed I cannot show her in person how a new one worked.As I start searching for a new camera of course I start with new items, but alas I am miser and I don't want to spend a fortune on something that may break within a year or so.  (I will caveat that the last Kodak easyshare was still working great after three years and was still working great until my wife dropped it on the ground at a bowling alley. lens first no less - and that camera had been all over the place, including Egypt).After searching new I fell upon the idea of refurb - I personnaly have been buying refurb products for the last couple of years and haven't seen any problems.  Both my iPods and Macbook Pro are refurbs.I searched all the Kodak's and Fuji and Panasonic and ended up with the Z812IS.  The price was fantastic (under $120 total) and the features were better than the last model.  The MP is higher from 6.1 up to 8.2, the Optical focus is up form 10x to 12x, so you can get that much closer.  Some of the buttons have changed and it takes a little longer to navigate them.  One major improvement is the capability to use AA batteries instead of just the CRV3/or rechargeable Kodak battery (Which I use).  If you don't have the rechargeable then I suggest the Energizer Lithium batteries - the best on the market.  The one item I do miss is the automatic sport function on the selection knob on top.  I have never used the email function.  The clarity and ease of use make this a top quality camera for a low low price (refurb only).For those looking for a high quality camera, easy use camera for technophobes and a cheap camera (refurb) than I highly reccomend this one.Thanks

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Allen Christian
Reviews.Content: This was a good upgrade for our family.  Picture quality is excellent.  Pretty easy to use overall.  The video feature is really nice quality although if you're using it in a high volume setting (concert, etc.) the sound recording is not great.My only real complaint about this camera so far is that it's a battery monster.  If you get this camera, plan on investing in some really, really good rechargeable batteries.  Otherwise it will eat batteries like crazy.I got mine as a refurbish deal so it is definitely worth the money we paid for it!!!

Reviews.Title: I have traveled the country with this camera and it takes perfect pictures.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "jeannebeanie57"
Reviews.Content: I would not want any other camera.  this takes Perfect pictures.  Have had no problems except when using low end batteries they do use up quick, I am talking 500 pictures quick. I now purchased the Kodak rechargeable battery to go with this camera and it takes pictures forever.  No problems otherwise.  just don't be cheap about your batteries

Reviews.Title: Great product, great price
Reviews.Author: Shak75
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera a little over a year ago, and even though I have not mastered all of its functions, I have been very pleased with the product.  I studied some photography, and was always a little hesitant to get into the digital camera craze (though this is my second digital camera).  I was looking to get back into photography, but didn't want to spend so much money for an XLR, and then I came across this camera.  It's surprising light weight, but still packs a powerful punch.  I love its features (the ones I've played with thus far) and I look forward to exploring even more.  I took this camera with me to the Caribbean for my cousin's wedding, and when I sent the photos around everyone thought they were the prints of the professional who did the wedding.  I am very happy with my camera!

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera Poor battery consumption!
Reviews.Author: B. Hicks
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera 4 months ago and can't tell you how many batteries we go through.This camera takes very good pictures and if you can work all the functions it has it can take excellent pictures.Its a bit bigger than the standard pocket cameras,but its very sturdy in the hand especially if your at the zoo hanging over the wall a bit to get a picture of a sea lion.

Reviews.Title: Durable and well worth the money
Reviews.Author: Ramsey Mill
Reviews.Content: As an art/design instructor in a high school, I needed to find a camera which was durable enough for multiple users, had solid optical, had features which were easy to understand, and was at a reasonable price to be able to afford to buy multiple cameras. After reading many reviews, I purchased the Kodak Z1812IS.After six months of the students using these, I am still impressed by the quality of both photo and video for the camera. Also, I particularly appreciate the aperture and shutter priority settings, which still give the user the ability to have some control over settings vs. a point and shoot. Also, the optical properties of the lens are of good quality. I was impressed for the price and would not hesitate to recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Great SLR-like camera
Reviews.Author: K. Darling
Reviews.Content: This is a fabulous camera!  I didn't think that it could take better pictures than my older Kodak, but I was really wrong.  The picture quality is amazing, and with a billion different shooting modes, you can always get the picture you want.  Love it - recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Kodak, you can't beat it.
Reviews.Author: M. Luera "Palm Desert Mimi"
Reviews.Content: Great camera.  Snaps pictures immediately without that delay some camera use.  Dynamite telephoto lens and 8.2 MP.  Don't know why the newer model of this costs so much more, this was the one to get.

Reviews.Title: great
Reviews.Author: H. Douglas "juscool"
Reviews.Content: ay this is a great camera for your money i took pics of the prince with this from a distance an it a very very good beginners camera kodak you really done it it also zooms in video mode too pics are clear little blur but nothing to really talk bout but its great!

Reviews.Title: I love this camera
Reviews.Author: L. Conklin "Aidan's mom"
Reviews.Content: I love the detail of close ups with this camera and the zoom. The quality of the pics are great.  I used this for my son's 5 year pics instead of having them done professionally and I am pleased.  I was especially impressed with the video as well.  I would recommend this camera for those who want something a bit better then point a shoot, but nothing complicated.  It had the same features as my old camera so I didn't need to read directions either.  I had to replace the battery pack quickly with 2 double A lithium batteries, but that's not a big deal.

Reviews.Title: Must have
Reviews.Author: Glenroy Brown
Reviews.Content: This is the best camera I have ever bought. Takes good pictures, has lots of settings to chose from. The price is very good compare to other camera from Canon, sony. My only disadvantage is the lens cover fall off very easily and the battery cover seem to be very delicate (Don't drop this camera).

Reviews.Title: Nice camera. Good store. Fast delivery
Reviews.Author: Cano Alfaro Manuel Francisco
Reviews.Content: Nice camera for beginners and advance users.It's a great camera for the value.The store has fast delivery.

Reviews.Title: Kodak Camera
Reviews.Author: Warren L. Mcilvoy
Reviews.Content: I have owned a Kodak 6490 in past especially the "easy share" option.  This Z812IS is easier to turn-on and off and is exactly a "point and shoot".

Reviews.Title: photo and video made simple
Reviews.Author: Marianne M. Alcorn "mommy 2 twins"
Reviews.Content: excellent camera: not only is it a great camera, but the video is awesome as well. the photoshare program just adds to the whole package.I love it and now have the Easyshare dock.

Reviews.Title: Excelent camara
Reviews.Author: René
Reviews.Content: I've had this camara for a few months already.  Excellent! The best value for your money.  Great options for people who like to tinker with aperture, shutter time and film type and also for just point and shoot photo taking.  Great resolution and video quality.  This is a buy I definitely don't regret and recommend.Update:  I've had this camera for more than 3 years now.  There are probably better ones by now, but this one is still great, working with no issues and taking amazing pictures.  Would definitely buy any other Kodak Easyshare of this type without a second thought.

Reviews.Title: Best Camera Ever!!!
Reviews.Author: Brenda R. Decapua
Reviews.Content: The pictures are crisp clear and beautiful. I know very little about cameras but the Kodak Z812IS makes taking pictures so easy. It is so user friendly that when you turn it on the lens cap automatically flips off. IDIOT PROOF!!! I love it.

Reviews.Title: Great camera that fully replaces my SLR...
Reviews.Author: Jon B. Phillips "Vino Jon"
Reviews.Content: I have used several different generations of Kodak's line of digi camera's - my last being a good solid snapshot 4MP camera.  After reviwing CR - and feedback here at Amazon, I asked for this from my wife at Christmas with the goal of replacing my trusted old film SLR.  I also want to include that my wife has a nice Canon sureshot - but it's too small for my hands - so in my quest to replace my SLR, I considered several models and went with Kodak because I was happy with my older camera's and it met my requirements.I'm just wrapping up a 2 week vacation where I have had a chance to really get to know this camera, and its capabilities.  I LOVE IT!  I can now say that I made the right choice - and I'm glad that I didn't pay the extra money for a digi SLR.  I'm not a pro - however I had been semi-pro many years ago when a good Minolta SLR was the only thing I could afford.  At the time, I had considered going pro and buying a high quality Mamiya...  The only drawback with this new Kodak is that you can't change lenses - however my style of photography today doesn't really warrant that requirement.The manual features that this camera has, choice in viewfinder capabilities, the many settings that you can choose and switch to - WOW is all I have to say.  After reading the booklet (a must because it's not all that intuitive until after you give the book a quick read) I have made use of almost all of the features.  From stiching a landscape, to the macro focus used to take pix of flowers, to the low light musuem settings... WOWIf you buy this camera, you should also buy rechargeable bats - there is a knock-off brand that is available here at Amazon (read reviews) that I highly recommend and is at about half the cost of Kodak's product.Happy shooting...Cheers!Jon

Reviews.Title: Kodak Easyshare Z812IS
Reviews.Author: Sally
Reviews.Content: Easy to use - remarkable close-ups.  Buy the rechargeable lithium ion batteries to use with it - regular rechargeables  do not work for more than a few minutes.  Learn how to suppress the flash (it explains how in the manual) and for a home camera - Wow! fun and easy to use.  Fast shooting, not like my last digital camera.  Image stabilization works as advertised.

Reviews.Title: Kodak Easyshare Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: V. Paulson "Vron"
Reviews.Content: This camera has amazing zoom capabilities and I have found myself amazed at the picture quality that goes along with it. The only complaint that I have is that the pictures tend to get a "fuzzy" look to them in low quality light and the night shots are sub-par, especially without a tripod or a stable base.  Otherwise, great camera for an awesome price!

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Stella M. Meyer
Reviews.Content: I found the camera(Kodak Z812IS) to be better at taking picture than I expected.Well worth the money. The only down side is that Kodak doesn't have a rechargeable battery come with the purchase. I was a little disappointed since the last Kodak camera I purchased did have a rechargeable battery. In this area Kodak let me down.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for a great price
Reviews.Author: B. Tracy
Reviews.Content: I don't have too much to add to all the praise on here for this camera, but I feel compelled to still give this camera 5 stars.  The picture quality is great.  It was easy for me to navigate the manual settings to take long exposure pictures of the recent lunar eclipse with only minimal leafing through the manual.  I've also had good luck with the sports camera mode taking pictures of my daughter's ice skating show.  I really wasn't sure when I saw the features of this camera for around $200, but it is a really great buy.

Reviews.Title: Very pleased
Reviews.Author: Taylor "Photo Novice"
Reviews.Content: This camera was an upgrade from a Kodak EasyShare DX7630, giving us more pixels and higher telescopic images, plus the option of being able to put on an even higher level telescopic lens.  We haven't used all the bells and whistles yet, but we are very pleased with the ease of operation and the results so far.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera great price!
Reviews.Author: Kari Zuidema
Reviews.Content: I am truly happy with this camera. It takes great photos and is easy to use. I have not had any problems with blurry photos and if I do it's operator error!! I love the bright vivid colors it captures. I have used both a 1 gig and 2 gig SD cards and they hold a bunch. I did recently purchase an 8gig SDHC hard and am looking forward to using it!I will agree that the Kodak software stinks. It's cumbersome and useless. I just use an SD card reader and upload my photos to iphoto which provides any editing I might ever want right now.If you're looking for a great camera that consistently takes great photos go with this one. It's very easy to use and user friendly. I love it!

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Robert J. German
Reviews.Content: This inexpensive camera is great. It can do a lot of tricks you would look for in a $ 600 camera. Pictures are top quality. Way to go Kodak !

Reviews.Title: Better Than The Price Would Indicate
Reviews.Author: Dennis in Houston
Reviews.Content: This is a fine camera for its type and, particularly, its price.If you want to take good pictures, learn more about digital photography, and not spend a large amount of money then this is the camera to get.The lens is great; it's real glass and not cheap plastic and its diameter is large compared to many other cameras in this price range.You can use the camera in Automatic mode and get great pictures.  You can also, when you want to, use Manual mode and learn how to control light and exposure time.  It can provide good training for later moving up to a more expensive DSLR camera.I actually have the older model, a Z710.  They keep improving it, mainly by adding more megapixels.  Look for the 'Z' in the model number.The Z812 is an excellent camera that you will like and will keep.  It's light enough to travel with you but advanced enough to get good pictures and provide flexibility for your shooting needs.I also bought a Tamrac Expedition 3 back pack to hold the camera and accessories, such as a cleaning kit, spare batteries, etc.This is a great value in a good camera.

Reviews.Title: Best camera for price
Reviews.Author: L. Hill "SAHMof2"
Reviews.Content: I upgraded from a Kodak easy share that I had purchased about 2 years ago.  We took a significant step upward with this camera - it's got tons more features than my previous camera.  I thought that I would be overwhelmed with the features and not use most of them. Not so.  I purchased this one primarily for the #of megapixels, the optical zoom and the speed at which it takes a picture (which can be an annoying feature of most digital cameras where the 1-2 second delay can make you miss some great shots.)  The delay is nominal (about .4 seconds) which is awesome.  It has a large lcd screen, also awesome, great optical zoom and a burst feature which I don't know how I lived without. I have investigated many of the features on this camera using the manual that came with it and by navigating the menus on the camera itself.  Very easy to use.I can go on and on about how awesome this camera is.  I love it. I have used it steadily since Christmas and can not complain about it.If you find one, buy it!

Reviews.Title: very good!
Reviews.Author: Renato Vasconcelos
Reviews.Content: Good price with great quality. I got it here for US$200. I'm just enjoying it. I'm not a professional but this camera makes really good pictures in a easy way to operate. The zoom is amazing, the screen is also good, otherwise, the camera is not so discrete, a little big to bring it together any time, I really dont care about that, because in my opinion, good pictures and video are the most important thing.

Reviews.Title: Love this Camera
Reviews.Author: Customer "Deal shopper"
Reviews.Content: I am not expert on Cameras, but have had several over the years. Never really happy. This camera is easy to use,takes great clear pictures. It is not to bulky to take everywhere. My son plays sports and I love that this has the continuous picture taking feature. I get all the action.

Reviews.Title: Great upgrades have made this an even better camera
Reviews.Author: Robert D. Passeretti "archer1945"
Reviews.Content: I own earlier versions of this camera and they have performed well.  The upgrades to the Kodak Easyshare Z812IS 8.2MP Digital Camera with 12x Optical Image Stabilized Zoomhave made it an even better camera!  The upgrades referred to are the higher resolution, a more powerful optical zoom and a big one for me, the image stabilizer feature which is great when using the zoom lens at higher powers.  It also appears to have a more powerful flash with greater range than my older models.

Reviews.Title: Fast, Good Quality
Reviews.Author: Dingletec "Linux Geek"
Reviews.Content: Huge improvement over our other camera, a Canon A410, in its recovery time between pictures. We love the quality of the Canon images, but are very glad we upgraded to the Kodak.

Reviews.Title: Alvaro
Reviews.Author: Alvaro
Reviews.Content: It is very easy to use and has very good video quality. I am very satisfied with the purchase

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Content: If you are considering buying a new camera, I would highly recommend the Z812 IS. I upgraded to the Z812 from the Kodak Z730, and it was worth the price. My pictures come out clear, and they can be cropped without losing very much picture quality. The Zoom quality is great, and The color is extraordinary! The camera has both Auto and Manual focus, and my photos are hardly ever blurry. The Z812 also has a Panorama Stitch mode. The Menus are very easy to navigate, and I haven't had to read the Users Manual once. This is my 3rd camera, and I couldn't be more happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Kodak Easyshare Z812IS
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This camera is great. Pictures come out crystal clear. I compared quite a few cameras before deciding on this one. This one had everything I wanted with a great price that couldn't bet anyone else.

Reviews.Title: Kodak Easyshare Z812IS Camera
Reviews.Author: Jay
Reviews.Content: The Kodak Easyshare Z812IS camera is excellent.  Everything that was advertised was exactly what I received.  The camera is excellent with 8.2 MP and 12x optical zoom.  The camera has many positives for a camera that is so small in size.  Pictures can be sent to the computer very quickly without any problems.

Reviews.Title: Not that impressed
Reviews.Author: Walter K. Diebert
Reviews.Content: I've own this camera for less than a week and I've already went through 4 or five sets of batteries. The cheap one Kodak sent lasted the longest. I use rechargable batteries that the Z710 that I really liked used. I could get nearly 200 pics out of one charge on my 710, this camera is lucky to get fifty. I don't know if I should try lithium batteries or take it back and stick with the 710. The light meter doesn't work as well as my 710 does in manual mode either. I read nothing but what seemed like bad reviews about the 710 but in my opion my 710 runs circles around this 812. The extra zoom is nice and the HD is cool but I like to take pictures of wildlife and in cold weather your lucky to get ten pics on a set of batteries. I wish I would have saved my money and just bought a SLR. This camera was over half of what I would have spent on one anyway.

Reviews.Title: AWSOME!
Reviews.Author: Darlene Huss "DISPATCH55"
Reviews.Content: I JUST GOT THIS CAMERA A WEEK OR TWO AGO. SINCE THEN I HAVE TAKEN SOME OF THE BEST PHOTOS I HAVE EVER TAKEN THANKS TO THIS CAMERA. YOU WILL NOT BE SORRY TO PURCHASE THIS CAMERA.IT IS REALLY AMAZING. I LOVE THE FACT I CAN TAKE PICTURES IN BLACK AND WHITE OR COLOR.ENJOY, I AM!

Reviews.Title: Did not work for long
Reviews.Author: PEW (Dept Purchaser)
Reviews.Content: Used camera briefly and took about 8 pictures.  Camera has already been sent in to Kodak for service under warranty.  Camera came with only a "tester" battery that lasted for 3 photos.  Was told by customer service that this was normal.  The few pictures that it did take successfully were beautiful, however shutter button broke within a day.

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT!!!
Reviews.Author: Willow
Reviews.Content: It is the first digital camera I decided to get before moving to a more professional camera for my career. I must say it was a wise choice. It is great for it's price. I have learned a lot from it. I love the SLR style of it. It is super easy to use and comes with it's own very basic photo editing but that is ok I do not like to edit my photos much anyway. I love it!!!Ok now that I have had the camera for a bit I do still love it but the one thing I have a problem with is the battery the one it came with lasted for maybe 100 pictures then I got a new rechargeable CRV3 battery and it claims to last for 300 pictures well it lasted me for about 40 pictures. I do not know if has to be a Kodak battery for it to work longer but it is annoying. If I could change it I would to 4 stars for the battery issue. I know it is not a top of the line camera but the battery should last longer.

Reviews.Title: New Users
Reviews.Author: johnlh "johnlh"
Reviews.Content: Ordered this item on the weekend and I had it by Thursday.  I was a little concern because some reviews stated that all items were not included or packaging was damaged.  I received my camera and all items were included and the packaging was new no damage.  So far I have enjoyed using the camera.  Took it on a road trip this weekend and my husband and I were able to take picture of ourselve with the self timer.  Have taken pictures of deer that were in my yard outdoors from kitchen window indoors without the flash and they came out perfect. So far I am really happy with my purchase

Reviews.Title: Awesome Kokak
Reviews.Author: Kevin W. Mathews "K-Dog"
Reviews.Content: I received the camera in only 4 days - very impressed. Camera works better than I had hoped. Good price, good product. Does everything I need it to do, and some I don't.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use!
Reviews.Author: R. Verhaegh
Reviews.Content: The camera is easy to use and takes great pics! I bought a memory chip of 4 gigs and can take 1586 photos! The photos are so clear and bright. The soft ware is easy to use. I highly recommend this product!

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I went to several stores to try out different cameras. This was the only one that worked great for a camera beginner such as myself and my husband. It has an auto setup that works GREAT. I got it here for about $95 less including shipping costs. What a great find.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: A buyer
Reviews.Content: Great camera, high quality pix, very functional, just HD video is not the way you think and very primitive.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful camera
Reviews.Author: Nadak
Reviews.Content: I decided to buy the Z812 IS Kodak after my 4.1 MP Fujifilm kicked the bucket, and boy was it an upgrade.  I LOVE this camera.  Currently, I am by no means a photography expert--I am more than content with the simple point-and-shoot aspects of this camera.  It is easy to figure out how to use it from the very start.  The pictures come out amazingly detailed with balanced and vibrant colors, not to mention that the zoom capabilities take my breath away every time.  I am also at ease knowing that, should I decide to learn more about photography in the future, this camera will allow me to play around with shutter speed and more manual options.The only reason that I did not give this 5 stars is not the actual camera's fault, but Kodak's.  I dislike having to install Kodak EasyShare software in order to download my picture onto my computer, as that means I can only transfer pictures onto my own computer unless I feel like carrying the software installation CD around and installing it on other people's computers.  There might be a way around this, but I am not a technological genius and have yet to figure it out.

Reviews.Title: Old S2IS user
Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: My sister got one of these for her hubby this Christmas. I have an S2IS for two years now. I love the pics that it took and the video was great. However, like my A-70 from Canon before that it has the E18 error that is common. I am annoyed at that and am fed up with it. Until I get a DSLR, I am getting one of these to replace the S2IS. The S5IS is twice the price. I was surprised at the picture quality and movie mode that my sisters Kodak z812 took. Not bad for the money. I am ordering the Kodak now. I'll use the S2IS with the E18 error as a weapon the next time I need to throw something at a mugger.

Reviews.Title: Lag between pressing shutter and photo being taken!
Reviews.Author: Jd131
Reviews.Content: This camera has a very annoying feature of not taking the photo as soon as the shutter is pressed.  There is a slight lag that, unless you are taking pictures of still life or scenery, is really annoying.  I have young children so they were often heading out of the frame by the time the photo was taken.  To me this is a deal breaker!Also the camera comes packaged with very minimal guide book.  If you want detailed info on this camera to really try out its features you have to download it from the Kodak website - inconvenient and irritating.  Kodak is trying to same a few dollars at the expense of their customers.I noticed too that the camera would often make a "purring" type noise.  On the positive side it did take nice macro photos.I ended up instead purchasing the Canon PowerShot SX100IS 8MP which is a fabulous camera and a much better choice.  The optical zoom on this camera is slightly less than the Kodak- 10 instead of 12 - but is a much better camera for a similar price.  It is very user friendly and intuitive and takes beautiful photos.

Reviews.Title: Don't wast your time looking for another camera!
Reviews.Author: A. Barton
Reviews.Content: I finally bought this camera after looking way too long at different ones.  I must have looked for 9 hours looking at tons of different cameras on Amazon, but none were nearly as good a deal as this one.  This is a great camera. Don't bother paying more for a different one.

Reviews.Title: this camera burns batteries like a hell!
Reviews.Author: ellen
Reviews.Content: I have used many types of digital cameras. I bought this one for my trip to Africa. I have used it for three years. It zooms well but burns batteries too fast! Four batteries will be burned out in a 6-hour excursion even though I didn't leave it on all the time. Kodak is behind bit time in terms digital technologies!

Reviews.Title: I LOVE THIS CAMERA
Reviews.Author: Kimbery
Reviews.Content: I really couldn't afford this camera being as we are needing every penny to feed our animals at our rescue this winter BUT I'm so happy I found it and the gentlemen selling it gave so much along with it.  We needed a good camera to take pictures of our animals for adoption.  Thank you [...]

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Quilthappy
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera! You can get it for almost $100 cheaper direct from kodak.com

Reviews.Title: Poor customer service, poor product
Reviews.Author: Kat
Reviews.Content: I received this camera for Christmas, and by June it had stopped working.  First, it stopped focusing.  Then about 1 in 25 pictures would turn up absurdly pixilated.  Finally, the small self-timer light next to the flash would not turn off even when the camera itself was off.  The battery itself had to be removed for it to go off.  I contacted Kodak, and since the camera was still under warranty, I sent it back to get fixed.  I just heard back from them that due to "corrosion damage" the camera is not repairable and not covered under warranty.  (They were kind enough to offer to return the broken camera to me for $12.95.)  I take very good care of my cameras.  It NEVER got wet.  I never even had it long enough to take it anywhere for it to get wet.  I do not store the battery in the camera because I have a rechargeable battery.  I cannot stress how incredibly aggravated and disappointed I am.  If Amazon.com would let me, I would give this product zero stars.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera
Reviews.Author: Rockford A. Holliday "rockman"
Reviews.Content: Very nice camera. Instructions are a little vague, but with a little searching and button pushing It can be figuered out. I have purchased a couple of lenses to go with it ( it does require the adaptor) and am looking forward to seeing how much more it will enhance my pictures. Will post a review on the lenses as soon as I put them to use.

Reviews.Title: Great pictures, but really loves batteries
Reviews.Author: Michael W. Dallien "Mike Dallien"
Reviews.Content: After comparing features in an entry level digital camera with a reasonable optical zoom, I settled on this camera (the Z812IS). ON THE PLUS SIDE: I am thrilled with the quality of the pictures that I have taken; the optical zoom is super! Camera is super easy to use; intuitive;  You can take great pictures the minute you take it out of the box. The IMAGE STABILIZATION system is terrific and has saved some questionable shots for me!ON THE DOWN SIDE: This camera LOVES batteries at $5.00 a pair and I am going to have to get the KLIC-8000 rechargeable unit before I go broke buying disposables!The zoom button is in a nuisance spot if you are using the eyepiece viewer as opposed to the 2.5" LCD screen.  The lens cover comes off too easily if you bump the camera!But, on the whole, I am absolutely SATISFIED with this camera!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: lovin' it!
Reviews.Author: Dawn T
Reviews.Content: I love the new camera!  I finally upgraded from what now seems like an antique.  It's easy to use, pictures are great.  the only recommendation i would have for kodak is to send camera instructions with the camera.  in order to actually learn more about all the features of the camera you have to down load/ print from the website.  may be convenient for some, not for all.  still learning how to take full advantage of the camera but love it none the less.

Reviews.Title: battery problems
Reviews.Author: two rocks "two rocks"
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera (z812is) for about 6 months and there are two things I can say about it the first one is this camera goes through a lot of batteries quick including rechargeables, and high end digital batteries. I am at a point that I am thinking of buying another camera as keeping up with the cost of batteries is vey high. The second item is I have tried a number of times to contact Kodak and every time I have been dicconnected. I would not recommend this camera at all.

Reviews.Title: NIGHTMARE camera
Reviews.Author: Camera Man
Reviews.Content: Shame on you Kodak-WHATEVER YOU DO, do NOT buy this camera-I bought it at a low price thinking it was a great deal after reading "rave" reviews. It started acting funny a month in. It started going through batteries very rapidly. It would randomly erase pictures I'd taken, or it would claim there were formatting errors, and the picture would never come out. It would not even focus correctly. I lost so many good shots that way. I tried formatting the sd card and the camera, it still didn't work. I even tried ordering new rechargeable batteries. The batteries they sent me did not even work.Bottom line was it was a nightmare. I stressed over it for a year. I will never buy a Kodak again. I'm going back to Nikon. This is one customer they have lost for life.

Reviews.Title: First Rate Vender
Reviews.Author: Joseph Griswold
Reviews.Content: The Kodak is a fine camera without a doubt...this would have been an upgrade of a previous model.  Its easy quick, and takes excellent photos.  This particular unit was sent back because it had a factory defect.  I am writing mostly to say the seller is first rate...return was easy without a problem...credit came quickly.

Reviews.Title: Eats batteries like crazy
Reviews.Author: Laurynas Surgailis
Reviews.Content: I got my Z812is about 8 months ago and took about 1000 pictures and maybe 50 videos so far. This is my first digital camera so I cant compare it to other ones. The Good: picture quality, video quality, zoom, the time you need to wait between pictures is minimal. Bad, or not so good: It eats batteries for breakfast, lunch and dinner. It doesn't even work on a regular AA batteries, I had to get Lithium ones witch don't last very long. It is a little balky, so you can't just stick it in your pocket. I wish it had a sleep mode button, because if I turn it on and off, it eats batteries, if I leave it on, it eats batteries. It does go to a sleep mode after few minutes, and then turns off after few more, but I wish there was a button for it. I will get a rechargeable battery pack and will update this review later. The picture quality is good, but they are big in size. Pictures will be anywhere from 0.8MB up to over 2MB in size.

Reviews.Title: Popup flash stops popping up
Reviews.Author: Arvind C "AC"
Reviews.Content: The popup flash is a big issue with camera like this. The popup flash stopped popping up for my camera and the camera is basically useless. The camera also shuts down every once in a while for no reason and I miss precious shots. I loved the camera initially because of all the features it has but now I hate it.

Reviews.Title: Still getting used to it.
Reviews.Author: Dixie
Reviews.Content: I do like the photos that I have took. I still need to fine tune what I want out of this camera. I was a point and shoot guy now I'm stepping up. You gotta buy a memory card for sure.

Reviews.Title: No power cord...other than that..good camera
Reviews.Author: William J. Speaker "bigwilliestylz"
Reviews.Content: I like the camera. Would be nice if it came with a power cord rather than having to buy rechargeable batteries and a charger. The only other problem I have is the lens cap doesn't stay on very securely. As far as functionality and such, it's a great camera for the price. Next time I might step up and pay more for a higher level camera.

Reviews.Title: Not Happy
Reviews.Author: Maria Debruin "unhappy"
Reviews.Content: I chose to buy this camera over the Canon with similar specs and after spending days trying to get a good picture, I decided to return it. The face recognition is garbage and recognizes everything but faces. For example, my daughter was holding a stuffed animal and it chose to focus on that instead of her(and I took at least 6 or 7 shots to try and get her instead). The zoom is nice, but it is not very stable and most of my pics came blurry. I just bought my parents a Canon for Christmas and will now be buying that for myself as well.

Reviews.Title: Z812IS
Reviews.Author: J. Cramer
Reviews.Content: Great Camera, Amazon was not the lowest price around, but the Cheap guy was such a hassle. He wanted to sell me all the accessories, "all I want is the camera" and all of a sudden they no longer had it in stock, it would be 6-8 weeks......Amazon did me proud, it was here in 3-4 days, THANKS AMAZON

Reviews.Title: Kodak not worth purchasing
Reviews.Author: FamiliesR4ever "thbirdbox"
Reviews.Content: Purchased this camera from Kodak with a printer.  Printer gave out after 6 months and now after 13 months the camera has given out.  The lense won't come out.  I downloaded the firmware to update per Kodak and it still didn't fix the problem.  Kodak tech support has people who are very difficult to understand.  Why do companies send their support overseas. The cost to repair is 110.95 including shipping plus tax. Or if I wanted to purchase another kodak they would give me a trade-in value of 15% off the new purchase price.  As you see I am not very happy about this.  I take very good care of my products.  I will be purchasing another camera and you can bet it won't be a Kodak.  Probably be a Sony as my last Sony lasted 14 years.  Went with Kodak because of the cost of the ink.  What a mistake that was.

Reviews.Title: Battery eater
Reviews.Author: SPARKY 2000
Reviews.Content: We have owned this camera for a year, and it has become an absolute battery eater. Batteries last for about 5 pictures before the camera shuts down. A trip to the repair shop under warranty did nothing to solve this problem. We have tried rechargeables with the same results. Do not buy this camera.

Reviews.Title: The quantity of megapixel that appear in the Amazon webpage is not correct
Reviews.Author: Alejandro Delgado
Reviews.Content: The camera look very nice, it has a lot of facilities for enjoy with it, but the quantity of megapixel that Amazon say that it has is not true, When I received the Camera in its body appears that has 8.1 Megapixel.

Reviews.Title: Excelente Camara Digital
Reviews.Author: D. Quiñonez "hajusto"
Reviews.Content: Es un equipo fotografico de excelente calidad. para mi que no soy fotografo profesional, con esta camara digital, adquiero fotos de una calidad insuperable por otra de su estilo que yo he utilizado. Solo me queda recomendarla excelente camara digital.

Reviews.Title: Junk
Reviews.Author: Deimos "."
Reviews.Content: This camera takes so so pics, but is not built to last what so ever.  Camera one lasted about 4 months with top notch care and just stopped working all together and support is nowhere to be found.  The second one I bought, same model just more pixel's  started to have flash problems with the bulp after maybe 30 pics and now wont turn on at all, again with top notch care after just 3 weeks.  Kodak camera's suck, I got a HP and it works excellent and isn't so cumbersome and lasts more than a few weeks for the  price. Kodak is such a Waste of money for such a hefty price for it's products.

Reviews.Title: Its break after 2 mo.
Reviews.Author: Piotr Kubiak
Reviews.Content: Camera do ok. pictures when it works . My unit brakes after 2 mo. (i did not droped it or drown it ) i do care about my electronics. Video is not hd quality - it is 720p but overall picture has alot of noise in it (evan outside in good lighting) You also have to wait long time to do another picture (like 5-7 seconds). You can use AA bateries but to use (supplied) battery you have to use harger and you have to buy it as the accesory!!!! what a rippof . No case for travel to . Kodak is gridy for costumers - DO NOT BUY THIS CAMERA IT LOOKS NICE BUT REED ABOVE - sorry for my english - Magdalena Kubiak

Reviews.Title: Cheaply made, poor quality photos
Reviews.Author: Bonnie
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because the reviews written were pretty good. My last camera was four hundred dollars so to see a camera with such good reviews that was half the price I thought I'd check it out. I was very disappointed. The fist thing I noticed was that the camera felt and looked very cheap.  The photo quality was grainy and a little blurry. I tried changing the settings and it only made it worse. The camera software was like a bad computer program; It would freeze occasionally and pause saying "Processing" and "magnifying". I sent it back, and Marcus Audio and video were very understanding and let me return the camera with no problems. I did a lot more research and bought the Cannon powershot S5 IS. I used to own the S3, until I left it in the rain. They are both great quality cameras with great photos- that's what's most important!. If you want the best quality digital camera that is not an SLR, with the best features buy either a Cannon powershot S3 or S5. Canon PowerShot Pro Series S3 IS 6MP with 12x Image Stabilized ZoomCanon PowerShot Pro Series S5 IS 8.0MP Digital Camera with 12x Optical Image Stabilized ZoomThey are absolutely worth the money. Once you have a great camera, you just aren't satisfied with 2nd rate quality!

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: Disappointed
Reviews.Content: I researched and purchased a Kodak Easyshare camera a little over a year ago.  I chose a camera with excellent reviews and awards.  Today it is discontinued by Kodak and broken (broken, not damaged).  Repairs to my $200 camera would be about $150.  Buyer beware.  I bought an expensive "disposable" camera.

Reviews.Title: instructions lacking for this camera
Reviews.Author: JoAnne Platero "digital novice"
Reviews.Content: If anyone has bought this camera and can help me, I'll be grateful. I purchased it because the other reviews said it was easy to use. But the instruction booklet is so poor I'm at a loss. I couldn't even set the date because the screen instructions were so unclear. I have figured out how to take a photo, review it and delete. But I have many questions. For instance, after I review and delete photo, the camera does not go back to operational mode. Rather I have to turn it off and on again. Also, when it works on flash and I am done using it, am I supposed to press down the pop-up battery light? And is there anything on the screen that tells me how much of the optical zoom I'm using, or should I just assume that the close-up function will stop when I reach maximum? The instruction booklet doesn't explain what all the symbols are that I seen on the LCD screen. The camera makes a noise when running. I'm not even sure when I've taken a photograph because it doesn't really click. How do I use image stabilization -- or does it just go into action when the camera shakes? I'm afraid to try the video function because I have no way of knowing how much of a 2GB card I'd be using up with video. Is there any way to know? Kodak's website merely repeats the meager information in the instruction booklet. I won't be using it with Easyshare because that was never my intention. I haven't yet tried to download the images using a card reader. I bought it because it has the best optical viewer for simple digital cameras. This would probably be a good camera if I could figure out how to use it.

Reviews.Title: never got
Reviews.Author: cin "cin"
Reviews.Content: I am not pleased!I ordered a camera six days ago and expected it to come now. It was cancelled today! Why so late? I wanted it for an important event. What horrible service. Don't order this camera they don't have it!!c

Reviews.Title: Happy but not Happy
Reviews.Author: John E. Mcmillan
Reviews.Content: The camera is fine and takes great shots in all conditions. I was particulaly impressed with the video mode. For  a still camera this takes great HD video. The down side is if you are considering lens attachments don't waste your money.1: you need an adapter to attach the lens to the camera this you have to buy seperate from the lens as it does not come with one.2: the Kodak Telephoto lens is only a slight improvement on the 12 x zoom.3: The Kodak wide angle lens is a waste of space you can take better shots without it.This Camera is not built to have lens's attached because of the adapter and the tunnel vision it creates so don't waste your money.

Reviews.Title: Kodak Z812IS Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: J. Tumbos
Reviews.Content: Received the product on time as it stated, the item is brand new and the very good thing is that amazon has the cheapest prize among the online store,that is why I like to shop in Amazon.com for its good quality products,prompt delivery and in cheaper prize.
